noun.description: A place where bodies are kept, especially to be identified or claimed.
examples: the cadavers were bagged and removed to the city morgue

noun.description: In a newspaper office, a collection of old cuttings, photographs, and information.
examples: conducting research in either a news morgue or a library

origin: Early 19th century: from French, originally the name of a building in Paris where bodies were kept until identified.
